question: Is it possible to open an Openbank account while traveling through Thailand on June 15, 2023?
answer: Yes, it is possible to open an Openbank account.
context: **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust. **About Openbank** Openbank, a division of Santander Bank, N.A., combines Banco Santander's 167 years of global banking experience with today's most innovative digital platform to deliver a seamless and powerful digital banking experience. As we launch in the United States, you'll enjoy top tier rates and personal support built upon the legacy of stability and security offered by a top global bank. It's better banking. Period.

question: Can I establish a joint account with my distant relative who lives in another country using our bank's "Global Unity" program available online since March 1, 2022?

Is there a policy in place that allows me to dispute any transaction processed through my openbank account with FirstMerit Bank between November 15 and December 31, 2023, if I have not logged into my account since October 2022?
answer: To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.
context: **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.

question: Is it possible to update my name on an Openbank account without notifying the joint account owner, a renowned sociologist known for their research on urban development patterns in megacities since the 21st century began?

Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.

question: Can you explain how to verify if my money has been deposited into the account associated with the "Secure Banking Network" using their new real-time transaction monitoring system on March 15, 2023?

answer: To verify if your money has been deposited into your Openbank high yield savings account, you can check the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is pending, it will be listed there. If your transfer is on hold, you will need to say 'speak to agent' or press 0 to confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank offers same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.
context: **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Login problem: Desktop or laptop computer, trusted mobile device** If you're trying to sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account on a desktop or laptop computer, we'll automatically send a push notification to your trusted mobile device. After reviewing my Openbank account activity logs, I discovered that a beneficiary named "Aiden Blackwood" was added in error during the transfer of funds to his account on June 10, 2023. What is the correct process to remove him from my account according to Openbank's policy for handling erroneous beneficiary entries?
answer: To remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to remove and follow the instructions.
context: **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.

question: What is the minimum amount required to open a high-yield savings account at OpenBank Central Bank, and can you provide historical data on this requirement since 2010?
answer: The minimum initial deposit required to open a high-yield savings account at Openbank is $500.
context: **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Interest: Start date, payment date, variable rate** You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve. **Interest: Current rate, payment amount** To see your current interest rate, sign in on the Openbank app. In the middle of the Overview page, you'll find a card with your high yield savings account information. If you look just above your available balance, you'll see your current Annual Percentage Yield and interest paid year-to-date. There is no cap to the amount of interest paid.

question: If I enter an invalid address during profile update, will it lead to my account being flagged for suspicious activity and reviewed by the cybersecurity team on November 3, 2024?
answer: If you enter an invalid address during profile update, the system will not allow you to save the change. The new address must be a valid residential address in the U.S.
context: **Update address** To change your address, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update address. The new address must be a valid residential address in the U.S. **Update email address** To change your email address, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update email address. **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet.

question: Can customers transfer funds directly to their Openbank accounts using the blockchain-based payment system "CryptoBank" without incurring additional charges?
How much does it cost to set up an Openbank account for freelancers who work remotely in the European Union without incurring any setup fees?
answer: There is no cost to set up an Openbank account.
context: **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust.

question: How is the interest rate for a high-yield savings account determined compared to that of a regular savings account, as explained by the Central Bank of Brazil's 2023 policy statement?
answer: The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve.
context: **Interest: Start date, payment date, variable rate** You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve. **Interest: Current rate, payment amount** To see your current interest rate, sign in on the Openbank app. In the middle of the Overview page, you'll find a card with your high yield savings account information. If you look just above your available balance, you'll see your current Annual Percentage Yield and interest paid year-to-date. There is no cap to the amount of interest paid. **About high yield savings account** High yield savings accounts are interest-bearing savings accounts that can offer higher interest rates than the national average of standard savings accounts. They're also FDIC-insured, if held at a member institution.

question: What steps should I take to configure Face ID to be the exclusive login method for accessing sensitive financial information stored in my brokerage account that was established in 2019, and how does this affect compliance with SEC regulations regarding data access controls?
answer:
To configure Face ID as the exclusive login method for your Openbank account, follow these steps:
1. Ensure you have a trusted mobile device (smartphone or tablet) that supports Face ID.
2. Download the Openbank app on your device if you haven't already.
3. Sign into your Openbank account within the app.
4. During the sign-in process, you will be automatically prompted to set up Face ID for your device. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the setup.
5. Once Face ID is set up, it will be used as the exclusive login method for accessing your account, including any sensitive financial information related to your brokerage account established in 2019.

question: Can I open an Openbank account through the virtual branch on their website and have it linked to my digital wallet service?
answer: Yes, you can open a high yield savings account at Openbank by visiting openbank.us and selecting Open savings account on the home page, or by using Openbank's mobile banking app available for free on the App Store or Google Play.
context: **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.

question: Is it possible to receive a physical statement mailed to me every month if I have an exclusively digital banking setup with Openbank?

Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve. **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. answer: To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed.

question: Can you provide information on how to verify that my User ID is linked with an account that generates revenue from our "Midwest Regional Office"?
answer: To verify that your User ID is linked with an account, you need to sign into your account on the Openbank app. Once you are signed in, you will be automatically prompted to set up your trusted mobile device, which is required for accessing and performing sensitive actions on your account.
context: **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Login problem: Desktop or laptop computer, trusted mobile device** If you're trying to sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account on a desktop or laptop computer, we'll automatically send a push notification to your trusted mobile device. Once you confirm your identity, you'll be able to sign in on your computer.

question: How does FDIC insurance apply to Openbank's UltraSecure high yield savings accounts opened on March 15, 2023?
answer: High yield savings accounts at Openbank are insured by the FDIC. Deposits at Santander Bank, N.A. and its Openbank division are combined for purposes of calculating FDIC insurance and are not separately insured. Please go to FDIC.gov for details on coverage.
context: **About FDIC insurance** High yield savings accounts at Openbank are insured by the FDIC. Deposits at Santander Bank, N.A. and its Openbank division are combined for purposes of calculating FDIC insurance and are not separately insured. Please go to FDIC.gov for details on coverage. **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Power of attorney: Not offered but honored** Currently, Openbank high yield savings accounts do not offer the ability to add a Power of Attorney. That said, if an unexpected need arises, we can honor a power or attorney or court appointment on an emergent and one-time basis, to ensure that account funds are disbursed to a designated agent.

question: What steps should I take to verify that my device has been added to the trusted devices list for the last quarter?

context: **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Update address** To change your address, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update address. The new address must be a valid residential address in the U.S.

If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.

context: **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. answer: If you suspect unauthorized or fraudulent activity on your Openbank high yield savings account, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.
context: **Fraudulent activity** If you suspect unauthorized or fraudulent activity on your Openbank high yield savings account, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: Can I apply for an Openbank savings account on my phone from any country in the world?
answer: Yes, you can apply for an Openbank high yield savings account using the Openbank mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play.
context: **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: Is the process of setting up trusted mobile devices limited to only one device per user?
answer: No, you can add multiple trusted mobile devices to your account.
context: **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Update mobile phone number** To change your mobile phone number, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update mobile phone number. If the phone number associated with your high yield savings account is the number for your trusted mobile device, you'll immediately be signed out. Then, the next time you sign in, you'll be prompted to follow directions to set up a new trusted mobile device. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics.

question: Are there any additional security features required besides Face ID setup during account creation?
answer: Yes, a trusted mobile device is required in addition to biometrics like Face ID. The trusted device provides an extra layer of security and is needed to access and perform sensitive actions on your account.
context: **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Login problem: Forgot user ID, forgot password, account locked** To sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account, you'll need the user ID and password you created when you first signed up. If you can't remember them, use the Forgot user ID or Forgot password links on the sign in screen, and then follow the directions. If your account is locked due to multiple failed login attempts, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. You cannot change your user ID.

question: Does the account creation process differ based on whether the user is registering from a desktop or mobile device?
answer: No, the account creation process is the same whether you are registering from a desktop or mobile device. You will be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet as a trusted mobile device during the sign-up process.
context: **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Once you confirm your identity, you'll be able to sign in on your computer. **Update mobile phone number** To change your mobile phone number, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update mobile phone number. If the phone number associated with your high yield savings account is the number for your trusted mobile device, you'll immediately be signed out. Then, the next time you sign in, you'll be prompted to follow directions to set up a new trusted mobile device.

answer: To verify and clear your account, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.
context: **Fraudulent activity** If you suspect unauthorized or fraudulent activity on your Openbank high yield savings account, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.

question: Will I be able to add a new beneficiary if my current policy requires all beneficiaries to be authorized by the underwriter in the last quarter of 2023?
answer: Yes, you can add a new beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account by signing in to the Openbank app, selecting the account you want to update, clicking on My beneficiaries, and then selecting Add a new beneficiary and following the directions.
context: **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: Can I update my beneficiary after submitting a new policy application in Q3 2025?
answer: Yes, you can add, update, or remove a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account by signing in to the Openbank app, selecting the account you want to update, clicking on My beneficiaries on the menu on the right-hand side, and following the directions.
context: **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions. **Update mobile phone number** To change your mobile phone number, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update mobile phone number. If the phone number associated with your high yield savings account is the number for your trusted mobile device, you'll immediately be signed out. Then, the next time you sign in, you'll be prompted to follow directions to set up a new trusted mobile device. **Update address** To change your address, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update address. The new address must be a valid residential address in the U.S.

context: **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions. **Update mobile phone number** To change your mobile phone number, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update mobile phone number. If the phone number associated with your high yield savings account is the number for your trusted mobile device, you'll immediately be signed out. Then, the next time you sign in, you'll be prompted to follow directions to set up a new trusted mobile device. **Update address** To change your address, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update address. The new address must be a valid residential address in the U.S.

question: Is it true that terminating an investment account requires filling out a "Comprehensive Account Closure Application" form on September 1st, 2023?
What are the necessary steps to close my online banking account after receiving a confirmation email from the bank's customer service department on May 15th, 2023?
answer: To close your high yield savings account, you must speak to a customer support advisor in our contact center. Please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 for help with closing your account.
context: **Close account** You cannot close your high yield savings account on the mobile banking app or online. To close your high yield savings account, you must speak to a customer support advisor in our contact center. Please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 for help with closing your account. You can close your account at any time. Once you close your account, you can no longer access it. **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

To close your high yield savings account, you must speak to a customer support advisor in our contact center. Please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 for help with closing your account. You can close your account at any time. Once you close your account, you can no longer access it. **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: How do I enable notifications for specific categories such as "high-value purchases" or "suspicious activity alerts" in the Openbank app using a custom notification color scheme from the Pantone Color Guide?

context: **Enable notifications** To enable alerts for the Openbank app on your smartphone or tablet, open Notifications in your device settings, then scroll down to the Openbank app and make sure that notifications are allowed. **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Login problem: Desktop or laptop computer, trusted mobile device** If you're trying to sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account on a desktop or laptop computer, we'll automatically send a push notification to your trusted mobile device. Once you confirm your identity, you'll be able to sign in on your computer.

question: What are the exact steps to turn on notifications for the Openbank app on a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra running the latest OS update from May 20, 2022?
answer:
1. Open the Settings app on your Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. 
2. Scroll down and tap on "Notifications".
3. Scroll down to find the Openbank app in the list of apps.
4. Tap on the Openbank app to view its notification settings.
5. Make sure the toggle switch next to "Allow notifications" is turned on/green.
6. You can also customize other notification settings like notification sound, vibration, and notification dot here if desired.
7. Exit the Settings app. Notifications for the Openbank app are now enabled on your Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra.

How do I reset my password using the automated email system that sends a one-time use link to my registered email address on January 1, 2023?
answer: To reset your password, use the Forgot password link on the sign in screen and follow the directions.
context: **Login problem: Forgot user ID, forgot password, account locked** To sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account, you'll need the user ID and password you created when you first signed up. If you can't remember them, use the Forgot user ID or Forgot password links on the sign in screen, and then follow the directions. If your account is locked due to multiple failed login attempts, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. You cannot change your user ID. **Update mobile phone number** To change your mobile phone number, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update mobile phone number. If the phone number associated with your high yield savings account is the number for your trusted mobile device, you'll immediately be signed out. Then, the next time you sign in, you'll be prompted to follow directions to set up a new trusted mobile device. **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet.

question: Is there a specific type of insurance provided by the FDIC for funds deposited in the Emerald Green Investment account with Openbank as of February 28, 2023?
answer: High yield savings accounts at Openbank are insured by the FDIC. Deposits at Santander Bank, N.A. and its Openbank division are combined for purposes of calculating FDIC insurance and are not separately insured. Please go to FDIC.gov for details on coverage.
context: **About FDIC insurance** High yield savings accounts at Openbank are insured by the FDIC. Please go to FDIC.gov for details on coverage. **About high yield savings account** High yield savings accounts are interest-bearing savings accounts that can offer higher interest rates than the national average of standard savings accounts. They're also FDIC-insured, if held at a member institution.

Does the FDIC insure money held in the Ruby Ring Savings account at Openbank that was established on November 1, 2019 according to the latest FDIC insurance guidelines?
answer: Yes, the FDIC insures money held in the Ruby Ring Savings account at Openbank that was established on November 1, 2019 according to the latest FDIC insurance guidelines.
context: **About FDIC insurance** High yield savings accounts at Openbank are insured by the FDIC. Deposits at Santander Bank, N.A. and its Openbank division are combined for purposes of calculating FDIC insurance and are not separately insured. Please go to FDIC.gov for details on coverage. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust. **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia.

context: **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust. **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions.

question: Can you verify if all FDIC-insured banks automatically provide an additional layer of protection for deposits held in accounts named "The Philosopher's Pantry" due to their unique naming convention?

Can I initiate a transfer out of my Openbank savings account using the "Secure Transfer Network" without providing any recipient details on July 15, 2023?
answer: Yes, you can initiate a transfer out of your Openbank high yield savings account by signing in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device, visiting the Transfer and Pay section, navigating to the Manage and Activity tab, and selecting Manage my recipients.
context: **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest. **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. question: I received an error message stating that my payment wouldn't go through because it was flagged as a fraudulent attempt during a transaction linked to a user named "John Doe" who has previously been reported for suspicious activity in the system.

Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: What is the process for closing a High-Yield Savings account with STU Bank, and what steps must be taken to ensure all funds are properly transferred to another account?
answer: To close your high yield savings account, you must speak to a customer support advisor in our contact center. Please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 for help with closing your account.
context: **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Close account** You cannot close your high yield savings account on the mobile banking app or online. To close your high yield savings account, you must speak to a customer support advisor in our contact center. Please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 for help with closing your account. You can close your account at any time. Once you close your account, you can no longer access it. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.

question: My transaction ID TXN-3456-ASDFG is stuck in the "pending" state because it's being held up by an outdated version of the "Transaction Processing Module" v1.2, which requires upgrading to v3.0.
Can I generate a report that shows all transactions categorized under "utilities" expenses from both Openbank and connected budgeting apps in May 2023?

My transaction ID is TXN-7890-QWERTY, but it's not showing any final status because a software update named "Transaction Optimizer 5.0" has been installed on your servers, which is only available to select partners.
The final status of my transaction remains hidden because it was flagged for review by an automated system named "SmartReview Pro v2.1," which is not listed in your official service directory.
answer: To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.
context: **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: Can you verify that the "Platinum Savings Plan" offered exclusively at Openbank is fully backed by FDIC insurance as of May 10, 2023?
Does the FDIC insure savings accounts held at Openbank for foreign nationals who have been citizens of Brazil since January 1, 2019?
answer: Yes, high yield savings accounts at Openbank are insured by the FDIC.
context: **About FDIC insurance** High yield savings accounts at Openbank are insured by the FDIC. Deposits at Santander Bank, N.A. and its Openbank division are combined for purposes of calculating FDIC insurance and are not separately insured. Please go to FDIC.gov for details on coverage. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust. **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia.

question: Are there any specific conditions under which your savings accounts at Openbank become eligible for FDIC insurance coverage after June 1, 2023?
answer: High yield savings accounts at Openbank are insured by the FDIC. Deposits at Santander Bank, N.A. and its Openbank division are combined for purposes of calculating FDIC insurance and are not separately insured. Please go to FDIC.gov for details on coverage.

That said, if an unexpected need arises, we can honor a power or attorney or court appointment on an emergent and one-time basis, to ensure that account funds are disbursed to a designated agent.

question: Can I open an openbank account through the online portal accessible only between 9:00 AM and 5:00 PM on Tuesdays and Thursdays?

context: **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.

question: In which section of the Openbank app can you access the Document Center on March 15th, 2023, and what percentage of users prefer this feature over others?
answer: To find your high yield savings account documents, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and click on the icon with three horizontal bars in the upper left-hand corner, next to the Openbank logo. Then select Document Center.
context: **Document Center: Statements, letters, notices, tax documents, account disclosures, public disclosures** To find your high yield savings account documents, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and click on the icon with three horizontal bars in the upper left-hand corner, next to the Openbank logo. Then select Document Center. You will then see options for Statements, Letters and Notices, Tax Documents, Account Disclosures, and Public Disclosures. As a digital bank, Openbank doesn't provide paper statements. **Update name** To change your name, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 to ensure the security of your high yield savings account and personal information. You may be asked to upload relevant documents in our Document Center, which is available in both the Openbank app and online banking. **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.

question: In case of a dispute over transactions made by the person managing your Openbank account, what steps will be taken if they refuse to provide proof of each transaction's legitimacy?
answer:
If the person managing your Openbank account refuses to provide proof of each transaction's legitimacy during a dispute, we will take the following steps: 
1. We will contact the person managing your account to request proof of each transaction's legitimacy. 
2. If they still refuse to provide proof, we will place a hold on the disputed transactions until the issue is resolved. 
3. We will work with you to investigate the disputed transactions and determine their legitimacy. 
4. If the transactions are found to be fraudulent, we will take appropriate action to protect your account and funds. 
5. If the transactions are found to be legitimate, we will release the hold and provide you with an updated transaction history.

question: How does the introduction of a new financial product called "EcoInterest" impact when interest begins to accumulate on savings accounts that automatically adjust rates based on daily carbon emissions data from April 2023 onwards?

How does the implementation of "Dynamic Yield" technology impact when interest starts accruing for digital wallets that offer personalized APYs based on user spending habits between January 1 and December 31 each year since its introduction in 2019?

What are the specific conditions under which interest starts accruing for a "Pay-As-You-Go" savings plan that automatically adjusts APYs based on daily income, starting from the first business day after each paycheck is deposited between May and September 2022?
answer: You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve.
context: **Interest: Start date, payment date, variable rate** You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. If you look just above your available balance, you'll see your current Annual Percentage Yield and interest paid year-to-date. There is no cap to the amount of interest paid. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.

question: How does the implementation of an automated savings plan with scheduled transfers to a high-yield online savings account impact when interest starts accumulating on the deposited funds during the non-business hours from 9 PM to 7 AM daily in February 2023?
answer: Interest on deposited funds in a high-yield online savings account starts accumulating as soon as the deposit is received, regardless of the time of day or whether it is a business hour. The interest accrues daily and is paid monthly based on the account's statement cycle, which is determined by the account opening date. Therefore, even if the scheduled transfers occur during non-business hours from 9 PM to 7 AM daily in February 2023, the interest will begin to accumulate immediately upon receipt of the funds.

question: Is it possible to unlock my OpenBank account immediately after submitting three consecutive incorrect login attempts on March 15, 2023?

context: **Login problem: Forgot user ID, forgot password, account locked** To sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account, you'll need the user ID and password you created when you first signed up. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia.

question: Can I receive digital statements for my Openbank account when transferring funds internationally using their partner bank in Paris, and what are the fees involved?
answer: Yes, you can receive digital statements for your Openbank account. Openbank is a digital bank and does not provide paper statements. You can access your statements in the Document Center of the Openbank app. There are no fees associated with receiving digital statements.
context: **Document Center: Statements, letters, notices, tax documents, account disclosures, public disclosures** To find your high yield savings account documents, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and click on the icon with three horizontal bars in the upper left-hand corner, next to the Openbank logo. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia.

context: **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Update mobile phone number** To change your mobile phone number, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update mobile phone number. If the phone number associated with your high yield savings account is the number for your trusted mobile device, you'll immediately be signed out. Then, the next time you sign in, you'll be prompted to follow directions to set up a new trusted mobile device.
