Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics.

question: Is it possible to open an Openbank savings account while residing in Canada for more than 6 months?
answer: Yes, it is possible to open an Openbank high yield savings account.
context: **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.

question: What should I do if there's a transaction labeled as "International Banking Solutions Ltd." that was processed through the "Universal Transaction System" in November 2022?
How do I dispute a transaction on my statement if it was made from "Global Bank" and includes an amount that was processed in "Ethereium" currency?
answer: To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.
context: **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Document Center: Statements, letters, notices, tax documents, account disclosures, public disclosures** To find your high yield savings account documents, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and click on the icon with three horizontal bars in the upper left-hand corner, next to the Openbank logo. Then select Document Center. You will then see options for Statements, Letters and Notices, Tax Documents, Account Disclosures, and Public Disclosures. As a digital bank, Openbank doesn't provide paper statements. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

question: How can I dispute a transaction labeled as "International Merchant Services Inc." with a reference number "ABC789" from my statement dated July 1, 2022?
How does your savings account earn interest compared to a high-yield money market fund on average days in March 2023?
answer: Your high yield savings account earns interest by accruing daily and paying out monthly when your statement cycles.
context: **Interest: Start date, payment date, variable rate** You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve. **Interest: Current rate, payment amount** To see your current interest rate, sign in on the Openbank app. In the middle of the Overview page, you'll find a card with your high yield savings account information. If you look just above your available balance, you'll see your current Annual Percentage Yield and interest paid year-to-date. There is no cap to the amount of interest paid. **About high yield savings account** High yield savings accounts are interest-bearing savings accounts that can offer higher interest rates than the national average of standard savings accounts. They're also FDIC-insured, if held at a member institution.

A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Update mobile phone number** To change your mobile phone number, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update mobile phone number. If the phone number associated with your high yield savings account is the number for your trusted mobile device, you'll immediately be signed out. Then, the next time you sign in, you'll be prompted to follow directions to set up a new trusted mobile device.

answer: To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.
context: **Close account** You cannot close your high yield savings account on the mobile banking app or online. To close your high yield savings account, you must speak to a customer support advisor in our contact center. Please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 for help with closing your account. You can close your account at any time. Once you close your account, you can no longer access it. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.

You cannot change your user ID. **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. question: Is it possible for me to receive interest payments on my high yield savings account in monthly installments starting December 1, 2027, at Openbank?
answer: Yes, you can receive interest payments on your high yield savings account in monthly installments. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your account monthly when your statement cycles, which is based on the date you opened your account.
context: **Interest: Start date, payment date, variable rate** You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve. **Interest: Current rate, payment amount** To see your current interest rate, sign in on the Openbank app. In the middle of the Overview page, you'll find a card with your high yield savings account information. If you look just above your available balance, you'll see your current Annual Percentage Yield and interest paid year-to-date. There is no cap to the amount of interest paid. **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia.

question: How often does the financial institution's algorithm determine when to add interest to my account based on historical spending patterns?
answer: Interest is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles, which is based on the date you opened your account.
context: **Interest: Start date, payment date, variable rate** You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. answer: To activate facial recognition for logging in, follow the prompts on your Apple device to set up Face ID biometrics. We've created a step-by-step demo for Apple devices at openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup.
context: **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Enable notifications** To enable alerts for the Openbank app on your smartphone or tablet, open Notifications in your device settings, then scroll down to the Openbank app and make sure that notifications are allowed.

question: Are there any specific features within the Openbank app that allow me to view all beneficiaries associated with an account on a Saturday morning?
answer: To view all beneficiaries associated with your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to view, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side.
context: **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions. **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Interest: Current rate, payment amount** To see your current interest rate, sign in on the Openbank app. In the middle of the Overview page, you'll find a card with your high yield savings account information. If you look just above your available balance, you'll see your current Annual Percentage Yield and interest paid year-to-date. There is no cap to the amount of interest paid.

question: What steps should be taken if there are no beneficiaries listed in the Openbank app despite having active accounts associated with it?
answer: To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions.
context: **Add, update, remove beneficiary** To add a beneficiary to your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select Add a new beneficiary and follow the directions. To update or remove a beneficiary from your Openbank high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app. Select the account you want to update, then click on My beneficiaries, which you'll find on the menu on the right-hand side. Then select the beneficiary you would like to update or remove and follow the instructions. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.

Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Interest: Start date, payment date, variable rate** You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve.

question: Are there any requirements or limitations on opening an account with Openbank if I have recently changed my address, such as moving from one city to another in 2022?
answer: To update your address, sign into the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then select Address. Follow the directions on-screen to make your change. The new address must be a valid residential address in the U.S.
context: **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.

question: What is a trusted device and how do I set it up in the year 2022 during the global pandemic?
answer: A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process.
context: **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Update mobile phone number** To change your mobile phone number, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update mobile phone number. If the phone number associated with your high yield savings account is the number for your trusted mobile device, you'll immediately be signed out. Then, the next time you sign in, you'll be prompted to follow directions to set up a new trusted mobile device. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics.

question: Could you guide me through accessing my statements via the Openbank app after I've logged into two separate accounts with different usernames and passwords that were created last year?
answer:
1. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. 
2. Select the account you want to view. 
3. Your transaction history will be displayed. 
4. To find your high yield savings account documents, click on the icon with three horizontal bars in the upper left-hand corner, next to the Openbank logo. 
5. Then select Document Center. 
6. You will then see options for Statements.
context: **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics.

3. You will be automatically prompted to set up your iPhone model X as a trusted mobile device. 
4. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the 2-minute setup process. 
5. Your iPhone model X will now be registered as a trusted mobile device for your Openbank account.
context: **Add, update trusted mobile device** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. A trusted mobile device is a smartphone that verifies that the only person who can access and perform sensitive actions on your account is you. A trusted mobile device is required. To add a trusted mobile device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. Setting it up is a quick and easy 2-minute process. A trusted mobile device is required. To update a trusted mobile device, deregister your current device, then add your new device. Sign in to your account on the app. Go to Security settings. Under Device management deregister your current device. To add your new device, download the app and sign into your account, at which point you'll be automatically prompted to set up your phone or tablet. **Update mobile phone number** To change your mobile phone number, sign into the app on your trusted mobile device, then select the red button that says Personal info. On the next screen, select Personal details, then Update mobile phone number. If the phone number associated with your high yield savings account is the number for your trusted mobile device, you'll immediately be signed out. Then, the next time you sign in, you'll be prompted to follow directions to set up a new trusted mobile device. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics.

answer: To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email.
context: **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust.

answer: Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.
context: **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest. **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Move money out** To move money out of your high yield savings account, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Manage my recipients. If you're sending money to an existing recipient, the process is easy: just select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions. If you're sending money to a new recipient, select Add new recipient. Follow the prompts to add your recipient's account type, routing number, and account number, as well as their name and an optional nickname. Once you confirm the information, select their name, then select Move money out and follow the directions.

answer: Yes, you can open a high yield savings account at Openbank by visiting openbank.us or using the Openbank mobile banking app.
context: **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.

If your account is locked due to multiple failed login attempts, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. You may be asked to upload relevant documents in our Document Center, which is available in both the Openbank app and online banking. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics.

answer: Yes, you can open a high yield savings account with Openbank by applying online or through the Openbank mobile app. The application process typically takes less than 5 minutes and requires a minimum initial deposit of $500, a U.S. mobile phone number, and a valid residential address in the U.S.
context: **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. question: When will I see interest added to my monthly investment portfolio statement for the holdings managed by J.P. Morgan Chase's New York office processed through their Miami server farm?
answer: Interest is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles.
context: **Interest: Start date, payment date, variable rate** You'll start earning interest as soon as we receive your deposit. Interest accrues daily and is paid to your high yield savings account monthly when your statement cycles. Your statement cycle is based on the date when you opened your account, rather than on the first or last day of the month. The interest rates on Openbank's high yield savings accounts are variable, which means they may change up or down at any time without notice. This can happen when market conditions change or considering interest rate adjustments by the Federal Reserve. **Interest: Current rate, payment amount** To see your current interest rate, sign in on the Openbank app. In the middle of the Overview page, you'll find a card with your high yield savings account information. If you look just above your available balance, you'll see your current Annual Percentage Yield and interest paid year-to-date. There is no cap to the amount of interest paid.

answer: Yes, you can open a high yield savings account at Openbank by visiting openbank.us and selecting Open savings account on the home page, or by using Openbank's mobile banking app available for free on the App Store or Google Play.
context: **Open account** Applying for a high yield savings account at Openbank usually takes less than 5 minutes. Visit openbank.us and select Open savings account on the home page. You can also open an account using Openbank's mobile banking app, which is available for free on the App Store or Google Play. To open an account, you'll need to: Make a minimum initial deposit of $500. Be at least 18 years old. Have a U.S. mobile phone number. Download the Openbank app onto a smartphone, which will become your trusted mobile device. Be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Resident Alien with a valid residential address within the 50 United States and District of Columbia. **Account held in trust: Not supported** Currently, Openbank is unable to open high yield savings accounts with ownership by a formal trust. **Add, update, remove joint account owner** To create a joint high yield savings account, sign up for your own account first. Once that account is open, you'll be able to add a new joint account owner. Sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and select your account. Then select Add an account owner and follow the instructions to send an invitation to the person you want to add. This person will receive an email with instructions on how to apply. Once that process is complete and they've been approved as a joint owner, you'll be notified by email. To update or remove a joint account owner, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0.

answer: To enable alerts for the Openbank app on your smartphone or tablet, open Notifications in your device settings, then scroll down to the Openbank app and make sure that notifications are allowed.
context: **Enable notifications** To enable alerts for the Openbank app on your smartphone or tablet, open Notifications in your device settings, then scroll down to the Openbank app and make sure that notifications are allowed. **Add, remove biometrics: Apple Face ID, Touch ID, Android fingerprint ID** A trusted mobile device is required, biometrics are strongly recommended. Openbank strongly recommends enabling fingerprint or facial recognition biometrics, as it provides you with an extra layer of security and streamlines access to your account. To add biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to add Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to add fingerprint ID biometrics. We've created step-by-step demos for both Apple and Android devices. If you have an apple device, visit openbank.us forward slash apple dash setup. If you're using an Android device, please visit openbank.us forward slash android dash setup. To remove biometrics, go to the device settings on your smartphone or tablet. If you're using an Apple device, follow the prompts to remove Face ID or Touch ID. If you're using an Android device, follow the prompts to remove fingerprint ID biometrics. **Login problem: Desktop or laptop computer, trusted mobile device** If you're trying to sign in to your Openbank high yield savings account on a desktop or laptop computer, we'll automatically send a push notification to your trusted mobile device. Once you confirm your identity, you'll be able to sign in on your computer.

question: Is it true that customers can request a physical bank statement for their openbank account starting from Fridays, even though the service is usually available only on Tuesdays and Thursdays?
answer: No, Openbank does not provide paper statements as we are a 100% digital bank. You can access your account documents, including statements, through the Document Center in the Openbank app.
context: **Document Center: Statements, letters, notices, tax documents, account disclosures, public disclosures** To find your high yield savings account documents, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device and click on the icon with three horizontal bars in the upper left-hand corner, next to the Openbank logo. Then select Document Center. You will then see options for Statements, Letters and Notices, Tax Documents, Account Disclosures, and Public Disclosures. As a digital bank, Openbank doesn't provide paper statements. **Transaction history, dispute** To view your transaction history, sign in to the Openbank app on your trusted mobile device. Select the account you want to view. Your transaction history will be displayed. To dispute a transaction on your statement, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0. **Move money in: Pending payments, transfers on hold, funds availability** If your transfer is pending, visit the Transfer and Pay section of the app. Once you open that section, navigate to the Manage and Activity tab and select Incoming Transfer Requests. If your transfer is on hold, please say 'speak to agent' or press 0 - so that you can confirm your transaction information before it can be released. Funds availability depends on how you made the deposit. Openbank does offer same-day availability for funds deposited by direct deposit and some other electronic deposits, as well as for wire transfers. If you initiated your transfer request from the Openbank app, it takes 1 to 4 business days for your money to arrive in your high yield savings account, at which point you'll start earning interest.
